intro: Arctous japonica, commonly known as Japanese rock白菜, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in alpine or arctic environments. Arctous japonica is valued for its hardiness and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
